intro: Sonchus ketzkhovelii, commonly known as the Ketzkhovel sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are hairy and alternate, with a distinctive serrated edge, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a cluster. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
